page.title: 13PRIMARY SCHOOLS
page.content: BAYNARD'S COUNTY PRIMARY SCHOOL In the 1970's another primary school was needed and Baynard's County Primary School opened its doors to 73 pupils in 1976.There were three teachers,a headmistress,a secretary and a welfare assistant. It was a fairly new concept in education being "open plan"and the first in the area.Instead of classrooms there are carpeted teaching areas which are defined by movable partitions.For messy work there are wet areas with tiled floors and sinks. A Nursery unit was built as part of the school and equipped but no money was made available by the local education authority to employ a Nursery teacher.However the building is put to good use by the school and a pre_school playgroup.
